title: Update snippets.py: Make it clear that repeatable PipelineOptions need to be specified as a list if set programmatically
body:
Make it clear that repeatable PipelineOptions like `dataflow_service_options` or `experiments` need to be specified as a list if set programmatically, so users do not inadvertently specify it as a string, to mirror the way they are set via the command line, e.g. ``` beam_options = PipelineOptions( ... dataflow_service_options='enable_prime') # This will not work ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). `ValidatesRunner` compliance status (on master branch) --------------------------------------------------------

title: Don't pin a particular version of Tensorflow.
body:
Don't pin a particular version of TensorFlow since dependent libraries, like TFX, typically install the latest available version anyway, even if an older version is installed in our containers, so it makes sense to use latest available version whenever we are rebuilding our container image requirement lists. Drive-by changes: alphabetical ordering of deps, regenerated the deps via ```gradlew :sdks:python:container:generatePythonRequirementsAll``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13309] Add BigQueryIO write test case for untriggered expansion with temp tables
body:
The new test will catch errors such as the one addressed in https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15825/files#diff-3edb3abd8909e7075e679e8b93420d4119858d6a9418b6ec10a204a592f062abR444. The problem was that `WriteRename` is no-op unless we have temp tables. Previously those tests were for triggered sources only, so for untriggered expansion, we were getting a false sense of security. Unit test for `WriteRename` itself supplies its own side inputs, so it is not an end-to-end test involving code in question. Tested with previous error to verify that the test indeed fails. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13175] Add KinesisIO.write for AWS SDK v2.
body:
This implements the missing writer for Kinesis on AWS SDKV v2, one of the big milestones to get feature parity between the SDK v1 and v2 based IOs. Currently the Kinesis Producer Library (KPL) is not available for SDK v2. Instead, this implements the writer using the async Kinesis client. There's two different writer modes available: - A default writer that asynchronously batches records to Kinesis with configurable concurrency. - An aggregated record writer compatible with KPL / KCL record aggregation that is implemented on top of the default writer. While record aggregation is compatible with KPL / KCL, aggregation here a lot less aggressive. Only records with the same effective hash key are aggregated to keep complexity manageable. Otherwise, the aggregator would have to be aware of the most up-to-date explicit hash key ranges per shard and react promptly to resharding to not risk data being silently dropped on the consumer side. https://docs.aws.amazon.com/streams/latest/dev/kinesis-kpl-concepts.html#kinesis-kpl-concepts-aggretation ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-13335] Use shorter, numerical indices for dataframe reads.
body:
We attempt to match user expectations by giving every element across all shards a unique index. Previously this was done by embedding the filepath itself in the index, but this would result in this (often quite long) path being duplicated for every element (sometimes exceeding the size of the data itself). As we expand the full set of shards before doing the actual reading, we can use an upper bound on the count to shift the indices of each shard to ensure uniqueness. A nice, round power of ten is used for the shift to visually make it easy to see where the indices come from if they are ever exposed to the user. In addition, fixes a bug where the file splitting was not taken into account when doing index uniquification. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-13073] UseParallelGC on Java container
body:
Follows https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/15739. As suggested [here](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-13073?focusedCommentId=17447601&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-17447601) by @tvalentyn, there seems to be performance regression when using only `-XX:+AlwaysActAsServerClassMachine` (which leads to G1GC). We believe ParallelGC is the most suitable here, considering it is used on Java 8 (used by most pipelines) and designed for high throughput. Note I left some comments with the reasoning for this flag and left `-XX:+AlwaysActAsServerClassMachine`. Let me know if it should be different. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Removed Pillow from requirements of containers.
body:
Pillow is only pinned for Interactive Beam screen diff tests to ensure that whatever the Python version is, the screenshot taken is the same. Pillow is a repackaged and maintained PYPI package of PIL while PIL is no longer maintained but is part of Python. title: [BEAM-13089][Playground] Enable playgroundPrecommit to run on GitHub Actions for pull requests
body:
* Added precommit tasks to each of build gradle scripts, playground frontend and playground backend * Updated precommit taks in global `build.gradle.kts` file * Created lint task for playground backend, updated script to install golangci-lint, made in supports llinux and mac * Moved linters to precommit, updated github actions to run precommit instead of run separate steps for lint/test/etc ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution!
